@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“kpop, post:13, topic:352993”]i feel so special u quoted my stupidity >.< gl guys[/quote]I’ll leave my signature, gonna change it to a lesson:

An if statement is like a burger, the top is if(bun == true)) { and then you add the tomatoes and salad, the salad = 2, the tomato = 3, addItem(2, 1); addItem(3, 1); and then you add a finishing burger, which will be a "}" so the code is this [code]if(burger == true)) { addItem(2, 1); addItem(3, 2); }[/code]

Ill try to make it fit

item.title: AHH! 100 compile errors! D:
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:11, topic:352993”][quote author=kpop link=topic=449308.msg3296398#msg3296398 date=1280972994]
do u have a copy of the section of code you deleted?

also everytime you have something such as

    public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {

it needs to have a semicolon ( --> ; <–) after the last )

public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount); {

adding a couple of those could solve all of your problems. Just 1 missing semicolon could cause 100 errors by itself
[/quote]

Please tell me you’re joking…[/quote]Lol I just noticed that, that should be a new signature lol.

Read full topic

item.title: AHH! 100 compile errors! D:
item.dc:creator: @Ahyo Ahyo
item.description:
@Ahyo wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:3, topic:352993”][code][codeif(command.startsWith(“ban”) && playerRights > 1) {
try {
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(command, “-”);
if(st.countTokens() == 3) {
st.nextToken();
String username = st.nextToken();
String reason = st.nextToken();
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(username);
for(int pU = 0; pU < protectedUsers.length; pU++) {
if(username.equalsIgnoreCase(protectedUsers[pU])) {
sM(“That is a protected user!”);
return;
}
}
if (otherPIndex != -1) {
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
writeLog(p.playerName, “bans”);
p.playerReason = reason;
p.savegame(false);
p.disconnected = true;
sM("Banning the user " + username + " for " + reason);
}
} else {
sM(“SYNTAX - ::banuser-name-reason”);
}
} catch (Exception e) {
}
}
if(command.startsWith(“checkreason”) && playerRights > 1) {
try {
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(command, “-”);
if(st.countTokens() == 2) {
st.nextToken();
String username = st.nextToken();
checkReason(“characters/” + username + “.txt”);
} else {
sM(“SYNTAX - ::checkreason-name”);
}
} catch (Exception e) {
sM(“Didn’t Work”);
sM(command);
//e.printStackTrace();
}
}
if (command.startsWith(“banusey”) && playerRights >= 1) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(8);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

		writeLog(p.playerName, "bans");
		p.disconnected = true;
		sM("You have banned "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to ban..");
            }
        }

if(command.startsWith(“resetdrop”) && playerRights > 1) {
ItemHandler.resetItemDrop();
yell("["+playerName+"] - turned on drops.");
}
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“resetnpc”) && playerRights >= 3){
for (int i = 0; i < server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i++) {
if (server.npcHandler.npcs[i] != null) {
if(server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2627 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2630 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2631 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2741 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2743 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2745 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2746 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2738 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 3777 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 3778 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 3779 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 3780){
server.npcHandler.npcs[i].IsDead = false;
} else
server.npcHandler.npcs[i].IsDead = true;
server.npcHandler.npcs[i].actionTimer = 0;
}}

	yell("System Message - Server npc reset by " + playerName);
}

 if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("help") && (!isInWilderness(absX, absY, 1))) {

triggerTele(3170, 9758, 0);
resetfollowers();

}
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“lmfaoed”) && (!isInWilderness(absX, absY, 1))) {
showInterface(20000);

}
if(command.startsWith(“newitem”) && playerRights > 0){
sM(“Items refreshed!”);
server.itemHandler = new ItemHandler();
}
if(command.startsWith(“tz”)){
sM(“You Have Killed The Jad = “+KilledTz+” Times”);
}
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“rules”) && (playerRights >= 0)) {
String name = command.substring(5);
sendQuest("@dre@PkPlanet -Rules", 8144); //Title
sendQuest(“u cannot trade real items,for Pro-Pk)”, 8145);
clearQuestInterface();
sendQuest("@dre@Player Rules", 8148);
sendQuest(“Ask For Mod Warning,Ask Twice Mute,No 1 Iteming!”, 8149);
sendQuest(“Respect The Staff,If You Do They Will Respect You!”, 8150);
sendQuest(“Duping Is Ip-Ban,No Trading Rs Accounts That Is A Mute!”, 8151);
sendQuest(“Farcasting Is Aloud,Looting And Pjing Is Jail!”, 8152);
sendQuest("@whi@Staff Rules", 8153);
sendQuest(“No Abusing, If You Abuse You Will Be Demoted”, 8154);
sendQuest(“If You Jailed,Muted,Banned,Ip-Banned For No Reason”, 8155);
sendQuest(“Then You Will Be Demoted!”, 8156);
sendQuest("", 8157);
sendQuest(“Thank You For Reading Rules!”, 8158);
sendQuest(" @whi@Owner Brian co nolzan", 8159);
sendQuest("", 8162);
sendQuestSomething(8143);
showInterface(8134);
flushOutStream();
sM(“Read Rules Good!”);
}

[/code]

I think it was around here. I did a little editing and now it gives me something like “public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {” and has an arrow pointing after the “k” in bank saying “expected ;”. Is that meaning i need a semicolon there to? i wouldnt think so lol[/quote]

take this line
“[codeif(command.startsWith(“ban”) && playerRights > 1) {”

and change it to this

“[codeif(command.startsWith(“ban”) && playerRights >== 1) {”

item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[code][codeif(command.startsWith(“ban”) && playerRights > 1) {
try {
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(command, “-”);
if(st.countTokens() == 3) {
st.nextToken();
String username = st.nextToken();
String reason = st.nextToken();
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(username);
for(int pU = 0; pU < protectedUsers.length; pU++) {
if(username.equalsIgnoreCase(protectedUsers[pU])) {
sM(“That is a protected user!”);
return;
}
}
if (otherPIndex != -1) {
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
writeLog(p.playerName, “bans”);
p.playerReason = reason;
p.savegame(false);
p.disconnected = true;
sM("Banning the user " + username + " for " + reason);
}
} else {
sM(“SYNTAX - ::banuser-name-reason”);
}
} catch (Exception e) {
}
}
if(command.startsWith(“checkreason”) && playerRights > 1) {
try {
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(command, “-”);
if(st.countTokens() == 2) {
st.nextToken();
String username = st.nextToken();
checkReason(“characters/” + username + “.txt”);
} else {
sM(“SYNTAX - ::checkreason-name”);
}
} catch (Exception e) {
sM(“Didn’t Work”);
sM(command);
//e.printStackTrace();
}
}
if (command.startsWith(“banusey”) && playerRights >= 1) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(8);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

		writeLog(p.playerName, "bans");
		p.disconnected = true;
		sM("You have banned "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to ban..");
            }
        }

if(command.startsWith(“resetdrop”) && playerRights > 1) {
ItemHandler.resetItemDrop();
yell("["+playerName+"] - turned on drops.");
}
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“resetnpc”) && playerRights >= 3){
for (int i = 0; i < server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i++) {
if (server.npcHandler.npcs[i] != null) {
if(server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2627 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2630 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2631 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2741 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2743 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2745 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2746 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 2738 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 3777 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 3778 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 3779 || server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == 3780){
server.npcHandler.npcs[i].IsDead = false;
} else
server.npcHandler.npcs[i].IsDead = true;
server.npcHandler.npcs[i].actionTimer = 0;
}}

	yell("System Message - Server npc reset by " + playerName);
}

 if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("help") && (!isInWilderness(absX, absY, 1))) {

triggerTele(3170, 9758, 0);
resetfollowers();

}
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“lmfaoed”) && (!isInWilderness(absX, absY, 1))) {
showInterface(20000);

}
if(command.startsWith(“newitem”) && playerRights > 0){
sM(“Items refreshed!”);
server.itemHandler = new ItemHandler();
}
if(command.startsWith(“tz”)){
sM(“You Have Killed The Jad = “+KilledTz+” Times”);
}
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“rules”) && (playerRights >= 0)) {
String name = command.substring(5);
sendQuest("@dre@PkPlanet -Rules", 8144); //Title
sendQuest(“u cannot trade real items,for Pro-Pk)”, 8145);
clearQuestInterface();
sendQuest("@dre@Player Rules", 8148);
sendQuest(“Ask For Mod Warning,Ask Twice Mute,No 1 Iteming!”, 8149);
sendQuest(“Respect The Staff,If You Do They Will Respect You!”, 8150);
sendQuest(“Duping Is Ip-Ban,No Trading Rs Accounts That Is A Mute!”, 8151);
sendQuest(“Farcasting Is Aloud,Looting And Pjing Is Jail!”, 8152);
sendQuest("@whi@Staff Rules", 8153);
sendQuest(“No Abusing, If You Abuse You Will Be Demoted”, 8154);
sendQuest(“If You Jailed,Muted,Banned,Ip-Banned For No Reason”, 8155);
sendQuest(“Then You Will Be Demoted!”, 8156);
sendQuest("", 8157);
sendQuest(“Thank You For Reading Rules!”, 8158);
sendQuest(" @whi@Owner Brian co nolzan", 8159);
sendQuest("", 8162);
sendQuestSomething(8143);
showInterface(8134);
flushOutStream();
sM(“Read Rules Good!”);
}

[/code]

I think it was around here. I did a little editing and now it gives me something like “public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {” and has an arrow pointing after the “k” in bank saying “expected ;”. Is that meaning i need a semicolon there to? i wouldnt think so lol
